content:
It's a nice idea--and I really approve of having math in exercises occasionally--but two things stand out:

1. The names of the points are not used in the solution.  To me, they seem like a needless distraction, especially in an "Easy" problem.

2. More importantly, I don't see where Kayou's remark was ever addressed in the problem statement.  I'm used to "inside the triangle" *not* including the points on the triangle.  A closed curve separates the interior from the exterior, but isn't itself part of either.   I don't expect everyone to agree with that POV, but it wouldn't hurt to be clear about it and not wait for test case 5 to  force a code change.  Simply changing the goal to "...points in which X is inside or on that triangle." should be good enough.

Problem with Test 8 - 'many data few output'

There is trailing white space at the end of line "AK 52;2.2" causing potential parsing errors.

Fortunately it's a Test and not a Validator, so I could catch it in debugging.  If it were in a Validator it could cause people a lot of frustration : /

Should really have been found before approval.

Good puzzle though.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Not so hard if we have the formula !!!!!!
Not so hard if we have the formula !!!!

Maybe you could include the formula to know if a point is in a triangle.

Great puzzle =)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: All tests are k for me.
This puzzle is interesting as it can be solved with diffenrents solutions.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: approved

It seems to be ok for me.
The only point is that we don't know from the statement whether a point on the edge of a triangle should be counted inside or not, but tests 5 and 6 will help us find the right choice (on the edge = inside).
Note that I haven't checked the uniqueness of the points.

Hi,

Starting with '8) many data few output' and everything after I find more results than what's expecting.

Failure
Found: 152
Expected: 125

For that test the first one I found that's not found by your code is "EZ-rE-tE" and the point is inside that triangle.

I would suggest to add an upper bound on n in the constraints section.

Also isn't this is false?: "All points are unique: they have different names and coordinates." In the testpair 8 you have two LO.

And also maybe add final dots to your sentences in the Input / Output section.

And etc ... is redundant. Either "etc." or "..." .

Title
* Suggest to change "including" to "enclosing".

Goal
* Please change "given" to "Given".

* Please change "system." to "system," and delete the line break after the word.

* Please change "given others" to "other given".

* Suggest to change "included" to "inside".

Input
* Line 1: Please format "X" and ";" as {{constants}}.

* Line 1: Please mention that [[x]] and [[y]] are floats.

* Line 1: Please change "the given point with its coordinates" to "the coordinates of point X".

* Next n Lines: Please format "n" as a [[variable]].

* Next n Lines: Please format ";" as a {{constant}}.

* Next n Lines: Please change "its" to "their".

* Next n Lines: Please mention that [[x]] and [[y]] are floats.

Output
* Please change "which include the [[X]]" to "where X is inside".

Constraints
* Please merge the last two constraints as:
All points are unique: they have different names and coordinates.

Thanks.
Ok Done. :)
Ok Rafarafa, it is done.
Thank you for the feedback. I will check again tomorrow my result.
Thumbs up for notiing the difference between "in the triangle" and "on the triangle".

I didn't put any formula because I think it can be solve using different ways/different formula so it is part of the challenge to implement the best formula according to you... So let see if you prefer to manipulate angle measure or if you prefer to calculate distances.... :)
Thank you for reporting the issue. I've updated that test just now.
Oops.  I guess this is a "Medium", not "Easy".  Maybe by then coders should be used to fields in the input that won't be used in the current module?  :^)

You are right threre are some mistakes in my code... I change the status: WIP.
Let me correct it then I will let you know.

Cedric,
I check again my code and data for test. It seems much better on my side.
Could you check again your code on my puzzle and tell me if it match with my results ? So I can publish it... 
Thank you :)

Hi,

Now the first test when I don't find the same result it "9) many data many output"
I found 858 instead of 853, I found 858 with 3 different methods to check if the point is inside the triangle.

For 10) Huge amount of points I found 11262 instead of 10193
For 10) Huge amount of points Val I found 35874 instead of 35859

for this one: "9) many data many output"
I found 858 instead of 853"
can you give me the 858 results you have ? So I can check with my results.
https://ctxt.io/2/AABIxh5yFg

Hello CÃ©dric,
I had some mistake in my code I think, I have the same result as you for test 9) many data many output: 858

I think it shoud be fine now.
Could you confirm on your side that you find same result ?

9) many data many output Val
Found: 874
Expected: 878

10) Huge amount of points
Found: 11262
Expected: 10211

10) Huge amount of points Val
Found: 35874
Expected: 36009

9) many data many output Val
You result : 874
Expected: 874

I remove the 2 last test.

I think the precision on float/double.... give different results.... So i just remove the last test.

So we are good now ? :)
Yeah I get the same results on everything now.
Thank you very much for your help and time. :)

>> Also isn't this is false?: "All points are unique: they have different names and coordinates." In the testpair 8 you have two LO.

The two LO are still there from testpair 8 onwards.

Maybe I'm misunderstanding your constraint: "All points are unique: they have different names and coordinates."

In test 8 (same name, different coordinates):

LO 11.8;51.48
...
LO 11.8;518.48

And in test 9 (identical points):

LO 11.8;5.48
Oi 63.6;21.62
Mi 13;5.18
LO 11.8;5.48

sorry you are right.
I hope it is fine now.
It's better to start with WIP instead of Ready status for your future contributions ðŸ˜‰
Yes sorry, My code was not good at first commit...
While WIP status is good for fixing mistakes, it's also a good chance for getting ideas from others to improve your contributions (even if they contain no mistakes).
